text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am dhan mistri a senior Cloud
support engineer here at AWS office in
Sydney today I'm going to show you how
you can reduce and prevent unnecessary
charges in Amazon cloudwatch let's get
started the first step is to identify
your cloudwatch usage charges the AWS
cost EXP exper analyzes cost and usage
data for AWS Services over time it
filters services and groups them by
usage type AWS region or API operations
let's identify the cost and usage of
cloudwatch in my
account sign into the AWS Management
console and then navigate to billing and
cost Management in the navigation pane
under cost analysis choose cost Explorer
under report parameter choose the
service as cloudwatch
and then choose Group by as usage
type you can now view monthly costs for
a cloudwatch group by a specific usage
type to learn more about how to
visualize and analyze cloudwatch bilding
data see the article Linked In the video
description after you have identified
the top contributors you can Implement
cost reduction methods for each type for
for cloudwatch custom metrics when
metrics are sent to cloudwatch All
cloudwatch detailed monitoring and
custom metrics are prated by the hour
and metered the put metric data API call
publishes custom metrics to cloudwatch
which incurs additional charges you can
filter the custom metrics published to
cloudwatch on the cloudwatch
console sign in to the AWS Management
console and then navigate to the
cloudwatch
console in the navigation pan under
metrics choose all metrics select the
region where you want to search for
custom
metrics in the search bar enter not AWS
and then press enter you can now view
the list of metrics that are published
to cloudwatch as custom metrics please
note these do not include the service
metrics published with detailed
monitoring
enabled to disable detailed monitoring
on ec2 instances you will first need to
navigate to Amazon ec2 console in the
navigation pin select instances and now
you should see the list of instances in
that region now you can filter the list
of instances with detailed monitoring
enabled using the search
criteria select the ec2 instance and
click on the monitoring tab you will see
the list of metrics enabled with
detailed monitoring now click on manage
detailed monitor monitoring button click
on the check boox beside enable and
click
confirm now your ec2 instance detailed
monitoring has been disabled and all the
metrics will be published at 5 minute
interval similarly you can disable
detailed monitoring on autoscaling group
launch templates and launch
configurations Amazon API Gateway Amazon
simple storage service request metrics
Amazon simple email service event
metrics and Amazon ginesis data streams
AWS elastic beanock
configurations for cloudwatch metrix API
calls cloudwatch metrix API calls call
charges vary for each API call beyond
the AWS free tier limit you can view the
list of cloudwatch API calls executed in
your account using cloudwatch metric to
view the metric navigate to the all
metric section on your cloudwatch
console
the cloudwatch API call metrics are
available by default under AWS usage
namespace and are categorized by AWS
resource from the list of metrics we can
filter the metrics for cloudwatch API by
adding cloudwatch keyword in the search
section we can select individual metric
from the list and then click on graph
metrics to adjust the visualization now
let's adjust the stat statistic time
range and period to calculate the total
number of API calls per
hour we can now see an hourly rate of
put metric data API calls for last 12
hours the AWS customers using AWS
cloudwatch console to view and list
metrics will not be charged for the
cloudwatch metrics API calls to reduce
the charges incurred for put metric data
API call customer can pre-aggregate the
metrics on the source and publish a
statistic set to the cloud watch let's
consider an example where your source is
publishing five custom metrics to Cloud
watch within a minute and how we can
aggregate this into a single metric
using a put metric data API
call for cloudwatch alarms cloudwatch
alarms incur a cost for each metric that
is associated with an alarm to reduce
cloudwatch alarms charges use metrics
that are meaningful for alarming and
delete unnecessary alarms to delete a
cloudwatch alarm you can navigate to the
all alarms section within the Amazon
cloudwatch console select the alarm that
you need to delete and delete
them for more information on automating
cloudwatch alarm cleanup at scale see
the article Linked In the video
description for cloudwatch dashboards
AWS customers using cloudwatch dashboard
will incur charges when they exceed the
free tier of three dashboards with a
maximum of 50 metrics per dashboard to
reduce the cloudwatch dashboard charges
customer can delete the dashboard that
are not in use to delete a custom
dashboard you can navigate to the AWS
cloudwatch console in the navigation
panel click on dashboard and you should
be able to see a list of custom
dashboards select the dashboard not in
use and click
delete sharing of dashboard can also
incer charges in form of get metric data
API call therefore it is recommended to
stop sharing dashboard when not
applicable to stop sharing a dashboard
select the dashboard and click on the
share dashboard
button now you will see the options on
sharing your dashboard click stop
sharing and confirm your
action now we can see the dashboard is
not being shared
anymore lastly
customers using AWS cloudwatch console
to view cloudwatch dashboards will not
incur additional
charges for cloudwatch logs cloudwatch
logs incur charges from inje archival
storage and log event analysis you can
monitor your log group data inje using
cloudwatch metrics to view the top 10
contributors for your log inje you can
use the cloudwatch metrix inside squarey
in the query Builder we will create the
query to find the top 10 contributors by
incoming bytes metric and group them by
log
Group after running the query we can see
the top 10 log groups contributing to
the data injection to the cloudwatch
logs to reduce the inje charges customer
can create the log group with infrequent
access class and create cloudwatch alarm
to notify any spike in the incoming
bytes metric you can lower cloudwatch
logs storage charges by setting a
retention policy to store data for
shorter period of time Additionally you
can set login sites queries to run with
shorter time frames and minimize live
tail session usage time which will in
turn lower your data analysis
cost for cloudwatch contributor insights
contributor insights charges apply when
you exceed one rule per month or when
more than 1 million log events match the
rule to reduce contributor insights
charges review and delete unnecessary
rules you can also disable a rule which
can lower the charges to disable
contributor insights rule navigate to
the contributor insights page select the
rule and disable
it now your rule is disabled and will
not incur any
charges for cloudwatch synthetics
cloudwatch synthetics incurs charges for
Canary runs that are Beyond 100 per
month and might incur additional charges
for other AWS services that use canaries
to reduce cloudwood synthetics charges
delete unnecessary canaries you can also
stop canaries which are not important
and can reduce the charges to stop a
canary open the synthetics Canary page
list the canaries then select the canary
and stop the canary using the
actions now you can see the canary is in
stopping State lastly make sure to keep
the canary runtime up to date to lower
the charges for other aw services that
Canary
use for container insights you can turn
on container insights on clusters that
run on Amazon elastic container service
and Amazon elastic kubernetes service
container insights on an Amazon ECS
cluster is charged based on the number
of services and tasks that run per
cluster container logs for ECS and E
clusters are collected by default and
incur additional cloudwatch logs inje
and storage costs to disable container
insights on ECS cluster navigate to the
ECS cluster page
select the cluster for which you want to
disable container insights and then
update the cluster
settings now you have disabled container
insights on the ECS
cluster eks container insights enhanced
observability charges are tiered and
based on observations that include the
unified price for metric storage and log
inje to learn more about how you can use
container insights to optimize your
Amazon eks costs see the article Linked
In the video description to reduce
container insights cost you can remove
the enhanced observability add-on from
the eks cluster to remove the add-on
navigate to the list of eks
clusters now select the cluster and
navigate to the add-on
tab now let's search for the enhanced
observability add-on and remove
it once you have removed the enhanced
observability add-on the eks cluster
will stop publishing container insights
metrics and logs to
cloudwatch cloudwatch application
signals real user monitoring and
evidently incur charges based on usage
and data inje review your usage and turn
off or scale back these Services if
they're not essential for your
workloads for cloudwatch internet
monitor cloudwatch internet monitor
charges are based on monitored resources
and City networks additional charges
might apply for Diagnostic logs that are
published to cloudwatch logs to reduce
cloudwatch internet monitor charges set
a quota for a maximum number of City
networks
monitored for cloudwatch billing alerts
as a best PR practice turn on billing
alerts to monitor your future AWS costs
and receive notifications when your cost
exceed specified thresholds you can go
to AWS billing and cost Management
console in the navigation pan select
billing
preferences now edit the alert
preferences enable receive billing and
cloudwatch
updates now you should start receiving
billing data on cloudwatch
metrics and now you know how to reduce
and prevent unnecessary charges in
Amazon Cloud
watch thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
